page.title: 10THE SCHOOL-SUTTON ST JAMES
page.content: The original school was built in 1859 at a cost of Â£800, and there were 166 children to start with. Ninety years later in 1949, it became an all-age school, with an age range of 4-15. In 1958, the Peele School in Long Sutton was opened, and senior pupils were transferred there. In 1971, a new school was built to accommodate children from Sutton St. James, Holbeach St. John and Sutton St. Edmund- these last two villages had their own schools closed. A part of the old school still exists, but, when the kitchen is converted into a classroom, the Horsa block will be closed. This is not expected to happen for a year or two.The main school is modern, light and airy, and there is a good hall with fixed P.E. apparatus. Outside there is a large playing field.
